title: Molokini Crater
description: Crescent-shaped volcanic crater with exceptional visibility and reef biodiversity.

title: Cathedrals I
description: Lava tubes forming cathedral-like chambers filled with ambient light.

title: USS YO-257 Wreck
description: Sunken Navy oiler turned artificial reef with turtles and reef sharks.

title: Turtle Canyon
description: Popular reef system frequented by Hawaiian green sea turtles.

title: Great Blue Hole
description: Massive offshore sinkhole with stalactites and deep technical profiles.

title: Bloody Bay Wall
description: Vertical wall plunge starting just offshore with rich sponge life.

title: Devil’s Grotto
description: Caverns and swim-throughs with dramatic light rays.

title: Dean’s Blue Hole Reef
description: Shallow reef surrounding the deepest blue hole on Earth.

title: SS Thistlegorm
description: World-class WWII wreck with cargo of vehicles and supplies.
location: Strait of Gubal, Red Sea, Egypt

title: Shark Reef
description: Current-swept reef with gray reef sharks and barracuda.

title: Elphinstone Reef
description: Remote offshore reef famous for oceanic whitetip sharks.

title: Medes Islands Marine Reserve
description: Protected reserve with large groupers and dense fish schools.

title: Blue Cave
description: Sunlit cavern producing intense blue hues.

title: Secca della Colombara
description: Volcanic seamount with gorgonians and barracuda.

title: Barracuda Point
description: High-current drift dive with massive fish tornadoes.

title: South Point
description: Steep wall dive with turtles and reef sharks.

title: Richelieu Rock
description: Submerged pinnacle with purple soft corals and whale sharks.

title: Hin Daeng
description: Deep red rock pinnacle with manta ray encounters.

title: Manta Point
description: Reliable manta ray cleaning station.

title: USAT Liberty Wreck
description: Shore-accessible WWII wreck covered in coral growth.

title: Cape Kri
description: Record-breaking biodiversity hotspot.

title: Yongala Wreck
description: Historic passenger shipwreck teeming with marine life.

title: Cod Hole
description: Famous for friendly potato cod encounters.
location: Ribbon Reefs, Great Barrier Reef, Australia

title: Blue Corner
description: Strong-current dive with reef sharks and jacks.

title: Chuuk Lagoon Wreck Fleet
description: WWII shipwrecks scattered across lagoon floor.

title: Silfra Fissure
description: Cold freshwater dive between two tectonic plates.

title: Darwin’s Arch
description: Advanced dive with hammerhead shark aggregations.
